column4: I'm upgrading from 7.10 to 8.04 and I got some scary error messages.
Particularly, it claims it couldn't install linux-image-2.6.24-19-generic-2.6.24-19.34_amd64.deb
sounds like you may have some unofficial sources in your repos.
Gees why does the help site have "(recommended)" on the live upgrade instructions then?
So is it likely that my box won't reboot again due to a botched kernel upgrade?
sudo apt-get install pastebinit  && cat /etc/apt/sources.list | pastebinit (Provide Pastebin link in channel)
Give me about 5 minutes--the box is still churning on this stuff, unless you think it's safe to run as it's chugging along.
Do you have a sep /home partition?
It wont work if package manager is crunching along somewhere else
ok I should wait until this thing is done.
It's rebuilding the package database right now . . .
k
I don't have pastebinit installed, and can't install it due to the screwed up state of my system hehe.  Shall I just paste that output off of paste.ubuntu.com?
manual pastebin is fine
http://paste.ubuntu.com/24561/
It looks like ia32-libs, linux-image-2.6.24-19-generic, and linux-ubuntu_modules_2.6.24-19-generic all failed to install.  That and openoffice.org was a complete wash
Interesting: apt-get -f install looks like it's taking a shot at installing the stuff that got botched in the upgrade.
I dont see anything in there that would be a problem.  All I can think is that something you installed manually or from source messed up dependencies
I think an apt-get -f install kicked it into submission
I just installed pastebinit now so that implies it doesn't have unmet kernel issues anymore.
!aptfix
I thought you had already tried that
I had tried the -f install command just to install pastebinit; but typing "apt-get -f install" I got the tool to try and install the unmet dependencies first.  I have no idea.
n/m I forgot the -f when I did pastebinit
